result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D Sprong

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Carter on 10/31/2022.
Review hearing on December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:33 AM Defendant Brian D Sprong in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Brian D Sprong. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

This is Attorney Herbers' first appearance. 
Atty Herbers requests a competency examination. Defense takes no position. 
Court will order an out-patient competency examination. Defendant gives address.
Review hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:21 AM Defendant Brian D Sprong in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant would like an attorney but is unsure if he qualifies for PD counsel. Defendant to go to PD's office to apply for PD representation.
Status hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status hearing on October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prior: Unknown,
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brian D Sprong not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Based on Defendant's non-appearance, the State requests a capias issued and bail be revoked. So ordered. 

RE-called at 9:15 am. Court received message that the Defendant is currently at the Waukesha County Mental Health Center and is unable to appear today. Court will quash previously issued warrant and reinstate bail, and set a hearing in about a month.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Returned Notice of Hearing Returned for Hearing on 07-27-2022 at 8:30am
Return to Sender. Temporarily Away. Return to Sender.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:49 AM Defendant Brian D Sprong in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
